ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] RE: How to pre-install your own scripts in the H3 GUI
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, some functionality you can do through writing some scripts, then calling them via the run script button.  But yeah, the UI is kind of locked in place.

X-eGroups-Approved-By: nlevitt via web; 09 Sep 2015 10:59:24 -0000
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
From: John Lekashman <lekash@...>

Well, some functionality you can do through writing some scripts, then
calling them
via the run script button.  But yeah, the UI is kind of locked in place.


Some things work, a bunch do not, as the code does make some assumptions.


A simple example, to disable cookies on a running job:
bean=appCtx.getBean('fetchHttp')
bean.ignoreCookies=true


Also add functions in the xml, and then call those.


But its a bit indirect, and you do have to look at the code to see what
works.
(or try it and see.)  And you can't just add a button here, to run this
thing.


John


On 9/8/15 3:34 AM, Kristinn Sigurðsson kristinn@...
[archive-crawler] wrote:
>  
>
> Sadly, no. The UI is pretty inflexible unless you dig into Heritrix's
> code directly.
>
> One option, I've considered (but not actually tried) is to use
> Greasemonkey scripts in the browser to facilitate a few common actions.
>
> - Kris
